resources.string: DEBUG ENVIRONMENT - NOT FOR PRODUCTION USE
Enter security details for upstream realm
You are attempting to access a function with a heightened security risk. Please re-authenticate yourself.
Invalid user or no-reset options configured
This tool will help you reset your password. You will need to have setup a password recovery question in your user profile prior to using this tool
You have entered a user which requires internet connectivity to reset their password. Please connect to the internet to complete your password reset
Password successfully changed. You can now login with your new password
Your password is expired and needs to be changed. Enter a new password below to change your password
Open your authenticator app and enter the secret generated

Open your authenticator application (examples: Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator) and scan this QR code. Then enter the generated code into the area below to validate your configuration when complete.
An e-mail with a validation code will be sent to your registered e-mail address (noted below). When you receive this e-mail enter the provided code below to validate your TFA setup
Are you sure you want to end your session?
Set the password for user account
Enter the new password for this user account
User must change password on next login
Enter the new PIN number for this account on this device
Re-enter your PIN code to confirm
Password does not meet complexity requirements
Password must be different from existing password
Object has been re-submitted for re-processing
Are you sure you want to ignore this conflict? The data will not be processed.
Queue object has been successfully ignored.
Are you sure you want to retry all the failed synchronization messages?
All conflicts have been re-submitted for retry
Are you sure you want to reset the synchronization log for this type?
Synchronization has started, access to data may be slow and/or adversely impacted during this process
Synchronization has completed - data services are restored
Are you sure you want to cancel?
You have unsaved changes on this page. Are you sure you want to abandon them?
Are you sure you want to nullify this object? This cannot be undone!
Are you sure you want to delete this object?
You are about to export potentially sensitive data from the CDR in XML format. Extra audits will be generated and your actions may be reviewed by an administrator. Do you want to continue?
All Substance Administrations (immunization, drug administrations, etc.)
All coded observations (problems, pain scales, etc.)
My subscribed place data (stock, policies, etc.)
Patients who live in my county
Patients who live in my state
All places out of my state/province (background after start)
All places out of my county/district (background after start)
All places that are assigned to my facility
Only users assigned to my facility
Only providers assigned to my facility
Only patients assigned to my facility or who came to my facility
Only persons (relatives) of patients who are assigned to my facility
Only acts (stock orders, adjustments, etc.) done by my facility
Only procedures performed at my facility
Only substance administrations performed at my facility
Only coded observations taken at my facility
Only quantified observations taken at my facility
Only text observations taken at my facility
Only patient encounters performed at my facility
The configuration tooling has been placed into advanced mode. Additional options are now available
Tap this option {away} more times to enter advanced mode

If your upstream requires the use of PKI authentication you may specify the certificate to present to the upstream here. PKI authentication uses encryption to authenticate your SanteDB node with the upstream using strong public key encryption
The type of object to replicate data for on this dCDR
Use this option to subscribe to patients with a particular identifier issued within an identity domain

This SanteDB client application needs to contact a centralized instanced called an "upstream realm". This screen will allow you to configure the specific details of how this mobile device will contact the realm's administrative management service.
A name for this device. For example: \'GoodHealthTablet1\'
The IP address or host name of the upstream realm controller
- Log all requests to the server
The port to contact the upstream on (default: 8080 or 8443)
- Force the use of encryption for communication
By default, SanteDB iCDR uses HTTP BASIC headers to express client identity, use this setting if your OAUTH2 server requires client_id in the body of the OAUTH2 request
If your environment has modified the default application secret for this app then use this option to override the default

This device name has already been registered with the realm. If you replace the device any currently registered neither device will be able to synchronize. Are you sure you want to replace this registration?
Configure the manner in which this SanteDB instance will interact with the configured upstream service.
This dCDR will act as a relay for all requests to the upstream iCDR. The dCDR will have no offline functionality and will serve as a web-portal to the iCDR
This dCDR will synchornize its data with the upstream iCDR and will provide this information to clients (and the user interface) even if the system is offline
Use this option to set the mode in which this application behaves
Use this option to specify when a forced synchronization should occur
Auto-resolve conflicts by forcing my updates over the server
Instruct the server to send back larger bundles (faster synchronization, however may result in timeouts on slow networks)
Send partial update messages to the server (PATCH option)
Use this option to control how often automatic polling occurs
Do not auto-merge conflicts on server
Your instance of SanteDB is already configured!
SanteDB can either synchronize the entire database, or can synchronize a subset of data based on places (geographic regions, villages, facilities, etc.)
Subscribe to all data (very large downloads)
Subscribe to a particular place (region, district, facility, etc.)
Enter one or more places you wish this tablet to subscribe to.
One or more facilities that you are subscribing to
SanteDB\'s disconnected client needs to cache data locally for offline use. There are a variety of storage engines which may be available on your platform, select the data storage options here.
Depending on the size of the subscription, and technology this device is using, you can get significant performance gains by selecting a more powerful database technology

SanteDB disconnected clients keep logs about the activities that occur on the mobile. While these are helpful for debugging and bug reports, they may impact performance or take up a lot of space. Use this panel to adjust the loggin levels

Use this setting to control how verbose the logs that SanteDB produces are. Note that these are not security audits or security logs, rather these are programmatic and application logs used for debugging. The higher the log verbosity, the slower this application will run.

SanteDB disconnected client keeps several security logs and audits of user activity on this device. This is helpful if this device will be offline for extended periods of time. Here you can control various security settings for this device
Use this setting to modify the password hashing strength. Note: You should only use SHA1 hashing in legacy mode, SHA256 is the recommended setting
Select one or more users that are responsible for the maintenance of this device. These people may be contacted from time to time to perform maintenance, diagnose issues.
Select one or more facilities which this device services
Use this setting to configure how long audits are retained on this device. Depending on internet availability and legal/policy requirements this setting may need to be changed.
Do not store security audits locally (not recommended)
Only allow users from assigned facility to login
Allow users to login when the central authentication server is unavailable

SanteDB can optimize the bandwidth that this device will use when communicating with the central instance, which can be set here. You can also setup any proxy information required for your local network
SanteDB can optimize the bandwidth used by this device by compressing data
LZMA compression uses more computing resources to compress payloads, however results in much less network use
SanteDB uses BZ2/9 (highest compression), this uses less computing resources than LZMA however the payload sizes are larger
GZIP compression represents a good balance of computing resources at the expense of larger payload sizes
Deflate compression uses ver little computing resources, however the level of compression may result in larger payloads with the server
This option turns off compression in SanteDB between this server and the upstream. This saves on computing resources however the payload sizes are much larger
Use a proxy to access the server
Do not present a client certificate
Do not present a client certificate
Compress data submitted to the server
Use this setting to configure the address of your HTTP proxy
SanteDB allows you to set additional settings on this page to further control the behavior of this instance
Are you sure you want to leave the upstream {realm} realm? You will no longer be able to access it.
You have successfully configured your instance of the SanteDB client services! If you are seeing this message, please restart the application
This application can operate in one of many roles on your server. This screen will allow you to configure which role you would like this application to take on within your SanteDB deployment.
Select the role/solution that this application will run as. If your deployment does not use solutions or applet roles you can leave this blank.
Selecting this option will automatically update applets

In SanteDB a \'service\' is a native plugin that operates within the application host context. You can use this screen to enable or disable services in the SanteDB application context. Warning: If you\'re unsure what this panel does, leave the defaults enabled
Configuration has been saved - restarting the application host. This page will refresh in {time} seconds
Your account is locked. Please try logging in at a later time, or contacting support
Invalid Username and/or Password. Please check the details you entered and try again
This record is sourced from an external system. Actions for this record may be disabled until you download a local copy
This record is deleted and/or marked as inactive and is kept for referential integrity and reference only.
Click/tap this message to extend your session
The city where you were born
Link this candidate local to the master record
Ignore this candidate local and NEVER flag the candidate again
Show a detailed match report for the match pair
Un-link this local from this master - creating a new master for the unlinked local and ignoring future matches
Un-ignore this record - it will be considered a duplicate in future matching activities
You are viewing a LOCAL record - this represents an unverified source of data from a source system. Editing this record would cause a mismatch in data between systems.
You are looking at a RECORD OF TRUTH. You may update this record with official registration information for the patient.
You are looking at a MASTER record. This record is synthesized from multiple LOCAL records. Editing the record will create a RECORD OF TRUTH
You are looking at a MASTER record with a RECORD OF TRUTH. Changes should be made on the RECORD OF TRUTH
This MASTER record has been verified. The data you are seeing is the OFFICIAL data from the RECORD OF TRUTH.
This is a MASTER record. Editing it will result in the creation a new LOCAL record for the administrative panel which will be.
You are editing a RECORD OF TRUTH, this record should contain the "official" data for this object.
This is a LOCAL record. Editing it may result in data mis-match between the system which supplied the data and the server
This data may be linked to other entities which may not be subject to MDM rules. You should either clone it convert it.
Are you sure you want to mark this record as a non-match?
Are you sure you want to integrate/merge this local record with the current master record?
Are you sure you want to detach (unmerge) this local record from the current master record?
This record is a RECORD OF TRUTH. This means that this record has been validated the "official" data for a MASTER record
{user} is currently editing this record - changes can only be applied once {user} is finished editing the record

This record has been flagged and masked/altered by privacy enforcement to protect sensitive information. You may be asked to re-authenticate yourself or you may be restricted for editing the record. Additional additional security audits have been logged.
This record contains data which was imported from another source - information may be incomplete

Controls the rendering of the entity relationship diagram for this entity.
  • Simple : Shows the physical relationships and logical relationships (without source)
  • Advnaced : Shows the physical relationships and logical relationships, indicating how the logical relationships are determined

Legend:
  • Physical Realtionship (i.e. in database)
  • Logical Relationship (i.e. inferred from master)
  • Verified Entity / Record of Truth
  • Inferred / Logical Target (i.e. the target entity of a logical relationship)
  • Focus Resource (this resource)
  • Reverse Relationship (entity points at this record)
  • Deleted / Inactive Target Entity
  • MDM Rewrite (i.e. LOCAL/LOCAL is realized as MASTER/MASTER on inferred)
This controls where SanteDB will collect produce log output. Each log writer can be filtered based on the event type.
There was an error backing up system files :" {error}
There are data objects downloaded that could not be processed, would you like to retry them?
Classification performed using absolute result score of attributes
Classify performed using normalized score of evaluated attributes
